name: Marco Island Marriott Resort, Golf Club & Spa

reviews.title: Pretty location, Excellent Staff but just shy of luxury
reviews.text: We had never been to the West Coast of FL and we were thrilled to be invited to a conference at the Marco Island Marriott. It is a beautiful spot on a perfect 3 1/2 mile, white sand beach. The location exudes calm and relaxation. Plus, there are lots of fun activities available in the area if relaxing on the beach is not all you want to do. It seemed like a wonderful place for families.

reviews.title: Always a nice break from reality...
reviews.text: I will start by complimenting the wonderful staff at this resort. Every encounter, even with the landscapers, was with warmth and a smile. We believe each person we met sincerely wanted to help us and make our stay a good one. The staffing of the conference seemed professional and efficient.

reviews.title: Last minute getaway
reviews.text: But, although the wing we were in had recently been remodeled, the general feeling that this is an mid-grade property remains. The property and landscaping are well maintained but you can see where they chose to cut the construction costs and overhead. Marble accents......not marble floors, for ex. The lobby and hallways were contemporary but again, just shy of luxury.

reviews.title: A Happy Place
reviews.text: Our oceanfront room was quite large and very clean. It was freshly painted and newly remodeled. But, it was strangely arranged and starkly decorated with mid-grade furniture. The bathroom had cheaper fixtures and it was here that it was obvious that it was a refurbishment of an 80's hotel......not a complete remodel. Odd, empty spaces. No door to block the light if someone was still sleeping. Bright light spilled through the ill-fitting door to the room from the hallway. The bed was quite hard and the linens and towels were old and rough.

reviews.title: Our anniversary weekend
reviews.text: The worst part was the old, clanking air-conditioner and noisy pipes from other rooms or floors! We unfortunately chose to sleep with the window open rather than have the air running. That worked ok for the time we visited but I can imagine there are many seasons that would not be feasible in South FL.

reviews.title: Great place!
reviews.text: I will return to this hotel. Everything was great, the room was nice, the staff was awesome, the food was good and the view was incredible! If you are looking for a place that has a great beach and just fun and relaxing this is the place to go.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: We came to Marco island for a short get away to celebrate our city's mayor going to jail for 28 years. The marriott is very nice and a very good location. It is about an hour from Fort Myers airport and the transports are somewhat pricey. The beach is very beautiful with many things to keep a family busy. We signed up for the golf package and the course was in very good shape and the people couldn't be friendlier. The bed was a bit soft but the rooms were nice.

reviews.title: EXCEPTIONAL...across all categories...especially service
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel and resort. The accommodations are clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The staff is EXCEPTIONALLY good. If you like relaxing by the pool or the beach...you can't miss here. Can't wait for a return visit!

reviews.title: Nice place to stay
reviews.text: After a bit of a rocky start we ended up having a very nice two night stay at the Marco Island Marriott. Upon check in we were given a room with two double beds instead of a king bed. We had to repeatedly call and cajole to get a king-we were told there were no king rooms available but one was miraculously found.

reviews.title: Wishing for the BEST Florida Vacation Spot? Right Here!
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a business function. I highly recommend the hotel for any business function. The staff was highly professional and the food and service were outstanding. Everything was done right! The trips that were arranged for our group were great.

reviews.title: great accomondations
reviews.text: great location, very accomondating staff and great restaurants and the service at Quinns especially the Markett brothers exceeded all that was expected. clean pool well groomed beaches and very clean throughout the whole complex.

reviews.title: Outstanding Marriott Hotel - More like a relaxed Ritz-Carlton
reviews.text: We recently hosted the Calvary Chapel Fort Lauderdale Married Couples Retreat at this hotel, utilizing the majority of the hotel sleeping rooms and conference space. Never before have we had such overwhelming positive reviews of a resort and particularly it's staff. The service is second to none the best Marriott service we have received and I would recommend this hotel for both business or leisure. Every room has a great balcony, most every room has some type of view and the resort, pools, beaches, restaurants and other guest areas are all perfectly maintained. We will most definitely be returning!

reviews.title: Relaxing by the Gulf
reviews.text: Enjoy a very relaxing weekend at this hotel and was very pleased with the accomidations and the friendliness of the staff. The location is perfect if you want to enjoy everthing a beachside hotel has to offer. The grounds are very nice as well as both pool areas, which does get busy, Enjoyed a nice sunset dinner at Quinns also.

reviews.title: Amazing Service; Great Beach
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marco Island Marriott for a wedding. The location of the hotel is amazing. One of the most beautiful beaches I've seen in the USA. This place is really about the beach and beach activities, which are many. The beach staff is awesome and they go out of their way to attend to every last detail. Ditto the hotel-based staff. Food was pretty good and the decor was nice. Seems much better than your typical Marriott -- more like a Renaissance property or just below a Ritz-Carlton. On the down side, the facilities, which are well maintained -- certainly have an 80s vibe to them. Also, there's little to do on Marco Island besides hang at the beach, which is usually fine with me.

reviews.title: Amazing Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I have traveled and stayed in many resorts both domestic and international. This Marriott is one of the best. Their attention to detail is wonderful. It is very clean, staff is so friendly and they all go out of their way to be helpful. Front desk, especially Angie was always so helpful and friendly. Little touches, such as cool towels handed out at the pool, fresh orange juice samples passed in the morning by the pool , and even freeze pops in the afternoon are some small ways that make this resort special and stand out from the rest. The grounds are amazing and so clean. It really is a treasure , and we will look forward to coming back soon.

reviews.title: Marriott Marco Island ...Oh heck yea!
reviews.text: The hotel grounda are beautiful, the rooms are clean (bit small but who cares). The food was very good (yes it is expensive your on vacation stay at a budget inn if you are cheap). The pools were awesome and the kids had a blast. My kids are 5 and 8 years old and they jsut had sooo much fun swimming and playing and meeting new friends. Drinks are fantastic (yes expensive your on vacation). The best for last: The beach is just amazing the sand, the water soooo blue you would think you were in the carribean...but you are in the USA baby. I absolutly recommend this hotel, just keep in mind it is procey, but you only live one. Oh wow alomst forgot awesome late night sushi binge eating....guilt free!!

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel are the most courteous, professional and friendly that I have ever encountered. The resort itself is magnificent and the rooms were great. A great, friendly atmosphere allowed for a very restful and enjoyable trip. Great beach on a calm Gulf of Mexico. Two excellent pools to choose from.

reviews.title: Location is great and front desk is the BEST!
reviews.text: Thank you to the management for the incredible training they provide to produce such world class results!

reviews.title: Nice property with flaws
reviews.text: First I would like to say that Allison at the front desk did everything she could to accommodate us. She is outstanding at her job! The resort itself is immaculate, the spa was BEAUTIFUL and my massage by Anthony was the BEST massage I have ever had! The spa pool area is so very peacful so be sure to enjoy it the day of your service.The beach is incredible and a Catamaran ride is a must. This hotel is within walking distance to restaurant and store off property. Although we did enjoy Finn's located on property. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars for all categories was because they had to shut our power down in our wing twice for about 4 hrs each time.Again Allie was amazing giving us another room for our last day there.

reviews.title: We were so spoiled!
reviews.text: This is a nice property overall. The beach is beautiful, the food is very good and we tried just about every restaurant on the property. However, upon arrival, we were shown to our first room...Immediately I spied a wad of blue bubble gum upon the headboard. How housekeeping missed that I will never know. There was also makeup on the pillowcases. We were disgusted and were given another room next door along with a $50 gift card which we immediately went and used at the tiki bar. This is definitely a family hotel and I love kids...but our family now consists of young adults. There wasn't a night that went by that I did not hear children running up and down the hall. I opened the door and there was a boy all by himself kicking the door beside ours. Then the baby started crying. Every night. We tried the spa. Be forewarned, this is not a top notch spa, just a way to unwind, but they do charge top notch prices. I would definitely skip that. It was not worth what I paid. Judging from the other reviews of this property, I would guess that we just had some bad luck. That happens sometimes. As I said, the beach is incredible, and all in all, how can you not enjoy a vacation at the beach?

aka: Marco Island Marriott Resort, Golf Club Hotel
description: Welcome to Marco Island Marriott Beach Resort Golf Club and SpaCome kick off your shoes and explore paradise found at this one-of-a-kind Florida resort, now celebrating the completion of a $225 million renovation and redesign that has infused every moment here with the spirit of Balinese beauty, hospitality and well-being - and added even more wondrous experiences to this already acclaimed destination. Nestled on three miles of pristine Southwest Florida beaches, the Marco Island Marriott Beach Resort Golf Club and Spa is the perfect destination for a family vacation, a romantic retreat, a memorable meeting or an unforgettable wedding. With several renowned restaurants, championship golf, a world-class spa and a wide range of activities and amenities, Marco Island Marriott Beach Resort Golf Club and Spa now offers even more - including upscale shops for men and women, a free-form fantasy pool with views of the Florida Gulf, new dining options and completely redesigned and redecorated guest rooms.
